greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) = T(n,k-1) + T(n-1,k+n) for n>0, k>0, such that T(n,0) = T(n-1,n) for n>0 with T(0,k)=1 for k>=0.
example: where the rows are generated as follows.
Start row 0 with all 1's; from then on,
remove the first n+1 terms (shown in parenthesis) from row n
and then take partial sums to yield row n+1.
Note the first upper diagonal forms column 0 and equals A101483:
which equals column 2 of triangle A101479:
where row n equals row (n-1) of T^(n-1) with appended '1'.
xref: Cf. A101479; columns: A101483, A121418, A121421; A121425 (main diagonal); variants: A136730, A136737.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 19 2008
